org.anarres.ipmi.protocol.packet.asf

Class AbstractAsfData

  • java.lang.Object
    • org.anarres.ipmi.protocol.packet.common.AbstractWireable
      • org.anarres.ipmi.protocol.packet.asf.AbstractAsfData
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    AsfRmcpData, Wireable, RmcpData
    Direct Known Subclasses:
    AbstractAsfBootData, AsfCapabilitiesRequestData, AsfCapabilitiesResponseData, AsfCloseSessionRequestData, AsfCloseSessionResponseData, AsfOpenSessionRequestData, AsfOpenSessionResponseData, AsfPresencePingData, AsfPresencePongData, AsfRAKPMessage1Data, AsfRAKPMessage2Data, AsfRAKPMessage3Data, AsfSystemStateRequestData, AsfSystemStateResponseData, AsfUnconditionalPowerDownData

    public abstract class AbstractAsfData
extends AbstractWireable
implements AsfRmcpData
    ASF RMCP Data (Enterprise number 0x4542). http://www.dmtf.org/sites/default/files/standards/documents/DSP0136.pdf http://www.dmtf.org/standards/asf [ASF2] Section 3.2.2.3 page 22. [IPMI2] Section 13.2 pages 126-127. This class manages both the RMCP payload and the ASF payload. Implementors desiring to provide the ASF payload should override getDataWireLength() and toWireData(ByteBuffer) and ignore the RMCP wrapper.

      • getWireLength

        public int getWireLength(IpmiPacketContext context)
        Description copied from interface: Wireable
        Returns the wire length of this packet. This must be exact, and not an overestimate. If Wireable.toWire(IpmiPacketContext, java.nio.ByteBuffer) writes fewer bytes than the computed length, the base class will assume error in the serializer and throw an exception. It is generally not valid to call getWireLength(IpmiPacketContext) on a Wireable which does not contain complete data, as the length of data-dependent fields cannot be computed.
        Specified by:
        getWireLength in interface Wireable
        Parameters:
        context - The IpmiPacketContext for this operation.
